item.description:
Learn the basics of your digital camera! This class is designed to provide an overview of your camera controls and how they impact your photography. If you are new to digital photography or not sure about what all the camera controls do, then this class is for you.

This class is first (PART ONE) of two workshops designed to get you familiar with your digital camera and making better pictures.


Some of the topics discussed will be:

Basic Camera operations
Understanding exposure.
Automatic VS Manual operation
Shutter priority mode
Aperture priority mode
Basic Flash

We will go over basic picture taking techniques, and discuss ways to take photos of standard subject and situations. Our goal is to gain some creative control over the results you get with your digital camera

We will also cover the basics of designing a photograph:

Composition
Tone
Shape and lines
Lighting direction/sources
Depth of Field (DOF)

Please come to class with your camera, owner's manual, memory cards and charged batteries.

Digital Photography for Beginners - PART TWO is scheduled for November 14, 2009 - Enroll for both to cover all of the basics for making digital photos.
item.name: Digital Photography for Beginners - PART ONE
